intro: Cornutia grandifolia var. normalis, commonly known as the common cornutia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cornutia grandifolia var. normalis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks.
